title: Fix backend connection failure ('Unable to connect to backend')

requirements.text: Diagnose and fix the 'Unable to connect to backend' error that users are experiencing in production. Ensure the backend actor is correctly initialized and that the canister ID environment variables are properly wired so the frontend can establish a connection to the Motoko backend on page load.

quotes: I am getting ' Unable to connect to backend'

acceptanceCriteria: The app loads without displaying the 'Unable to connect to backend' error message
The ActorLoadingGuard component transitions from loading state to ready state successfully
Backend queries (e.g., fetching news articles on the home page) complete without connection errors
The retry button in the ActorLoadingGuard is not needed under normal conditions

constraints: Do not change the backend data model or existing Motoko actor logic
Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts or frontend/src/main.tsx
nonGoals: Adding new features or UI changes unrelated to the connection fix
Changing authentication flow or Internet Identity integration
